intro: Piptocarpha cardenasii, commonly known as the Cienega grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. This plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and riparian areas, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Piptocarpha cardenasii has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insect and bird species.
